text:
Went to the Hamptons for a brunch date last weekend. We were seated immediately by a friendly hostess and had a waiter at our table for drinks within two minutes. The service was prompt and friendly throughout the meal, but we switched waiters before even ordering food. It was a little odd to have a new waiter come to our table and help us while our previous one stood around and waited on a single table, and it seemed like there might have been too much staff on shift. 

Their endless mimosas or bloody Mary's are a good deal at less than or right around $20. They're not super special or different than any other mimosa, but they did offer a flavor variant if you wanted. I've got to say, my waiter was QUICK on the refills... as in, he'd bring me one before I was done. Not a bad thing! 

For food, I got the chicken biscuit. It tasted good but I felt like I needed to scarf it down before the gravy soaked everything and made my meal mush. My date got the short rib sandwich, which was delicious but a bit messy. Portions were great and it didn't take long to arrive. 

I would definitely return for dinner or even another brunch. The venue is lovely and upscale but trendy and the staff was all friendly. I personally think they could be better organized, as the staff seemed continuously confused over who had what table, but overall I'd recommend trying it.

Got a chance to check out Hamptons for the first time 2 weeks ago and I've already been 4 times! The food is absolutely incredible! I tried the swordfish, steak, and the chicken and all were to die for! The deserts were out of this world! If you get a chance to try the carrot cake, it is the most delicious thing you've ever tried. When it comes to cocktails, don't even get me started. You MUST try this restaurant! It is by far my favorite at tivolli!

This place was amazing! It was delicious & very well priced! We found it here on yelp & when we pulled up it was so nice we kept checking the menu making sure it was the prices I had seen & they were! Everything was delicious & perfect & the staff was lovely! I definitely recommend it & will definitely be back!
Great food, service and ambiance!  I had the short rib sandwich for lunch, came with homemade catsup with your fries, very tasty!  Ordered the garlic spinach which so good!  Highly recommend!
The Hamptons is a new hot spot for great food and ambiance. We had the filet mignon, melt in your mouth! Great service, we will definitely be back.

We came here on their first weekend of opening and had a Wonderful brunch. I loved my smoked salmon crepe and my husband loved his crab eggs benedict! Service was great too. For a brand new restaurant, they seem to have their act together which isn't always the case! Hope they keep it up. Can't wait to go back!

It's always a great time for girls night and great food. While I had to supply my own ladies, Hamptons seriously served some delicious food all evening. We loved the tomato soup accompanied by mini grilled cheese sandwiches and the Hummus for starters. After dinner I think the skirt steak, chicken and swordfish plates were licked clean! Appetizers and dinner were so good we thought it might be a tough act to follow, but dessert did not disappoint. The chocolate cake, carrot cake and bananas foster sealed the deal. Our server Eric was attentive and sweet throughout the evening. Definitely looking forward to the next girls' night out at Hamptons!

I BARELY Yelp and am not some smug Vegas foodie but I had to review this place. It's new and the inside could be better but the overall food experience is fantastic. The only nicer place in Tivoli is Echo and Rig but that's a completely different price point.

Bottomless mimosas and you can't really go wrong with the menu. Smoke salmon creoe was great and deviled eggs with bacon was on point.

Go here so it can be here longer than the last restaurants that existed in this space!

Everything about this place was exceptional. The host was welcoming the owner or manager, not sure, was friendly and the food was delicious. First was the wine board that was off the hook. The crab cakes actually had plenty of crab and were flavorful with the accompanying salad. The avocado fries were so good I almost had to order another. And last but not least the Strawberry & Golden Beet Carpaccio was a nice combination that was full of flavors. Can't wait to go back.
This is by far the best brunch place in Summerlin! Amazing bottomless brunch, and they even gave my hungry puppy some bacon for free ;)

Absolutely beautiful restaurant in a great location with a very friendly attentive staff. The menu wasn't overstuffed with nonsense, just a great array of well thought out dishes that all sounded great. Started with the hummus with pickled veg and the deviled eggs, both were the perfect amount for a starter and absolutely delicious. For our mains we got the Salmon and the Swordfish both I highly recommend. The salmon was sat atop an amazing sauce I couldn't get enough of. The sword wish comes out as  grilled steak with street taco sized tortillas and I really well spiced guacamole and a slaw to build your own tacos. 
Can't wait to go back and try the tomahawk steak. Definitely a great spot.

Me gusto! Came in for happy hour, sat in the patio, felt a nice breeze so I decided to have a Sauvignon blanc. It was quiet lovely, the wait staff was very knowledgeable and friendly, knew the menu inside and out. I ordered Mary's chicken, it was nice and crispy. The risotto was perfectly cooked and the asparagus was crunchy, everything was just right. 

Loved it , I'll be coming back.

I feel like nothing in this location has lasted and we finally have a spot that will and if it doesn't I will be veryyyyy upset. So amazing! Came for brunch on a Saturday and everything was delicious! Crab cakes Benedict, egg white frittata tomato soup, salmon crepes and buffalo onion rings were just some of our favs!

I paid $19 for Johnnie Walker Black, that was a little much.  had the New York steak wasn't good lots of gristle and tough. Potatoes were cold bill came to $200 for the two of us The server did a great job
don't waste your time or your money

Been here 5 times now.  Always good service.  We sit at the bar, Josh Wood is very knowledgeable and helpful.  Today, I had the chicken and waffles, the chicken had the right amount of crisp and still tender and moist inside.  My wife had the Poke'.  The cinnamon chips are a nice compliment to the tuna. In previous visits we've had the avocado toast, cubano sandwich,hamptons burger, crab cakes, and the deviled eggs.  Everything is well thought out and consistently excellent.  Josh our favorite server and  the Hamptons a top 5 Vegas restaurant.  Well worth a visit!!

Dining in has been pretty good in the past. However ordering to go through door dash was a disaster. The onion soup had no cheese and was so sour like drinking straight vinegar. I really enjoyed it dining in but it's like they didn't care for the to go order. The salmon was just ok. It wasn't a filet but like a circular patty. Probably won't go back even though I have quite a few friends that like it. There was just no care or thought put in my food tonight and for over $50 that's not ok.
Loved it! Service, food was fantastic, beautiful place. Perfect portions and multiple options.

I've been excited to check out Hamptons since I saw their Overstuffed Bacon & Eggs app- deviled eggs are a favorite of mine! Finally popped in with a friend for a weekend brunch visit. 

The food was decent. Our server was super sweet and made plenty of suggestions and pointed out dishes that were specific to the brunch menu, which was helpful. The bruschettas in particular are a great shareable app- we got to try both  when they accidentally brought the wrong order to the table.

Their lemon-ricotta pancakes with blueberries went over well with my friend Loren, but the apps I ordered were just okay. The deviled eggs were nicely creamy, but the Buffalo Rings had minimal buffalo and were on the plain side.

Service was very friendly, but food was slow to come out, there were errors with our order, and the check took a solid half hour to sort out. I might try a few more dishes during HH, since they're so close to work.

Staff and patrons alike were very warm. Saturday nights they have live jazz music and Happy Hour 7 days a week from 3-6pm on drinks and food. I've only had appetizers so far but will be back to try more items.

Came to try out Hamptons for a last minute birthday meal with a couple friends Sunday 11/26. We got seated at the second booth and when our server arrived to greet us she seemed very annoyed that I had asked for the happy hour menu. Mind you at the time we got sat we were the only table inside. Our server was blonde about 5'6 (I think her name started with a "C") and she did not check on us other than to try and clear the appetizer plates (which still had food on them). The food itself was tasty and the plating was very cute. The service on the other hand was lacking to say the least. I don't think I will be coming back. 

P.S. I had 10+ year career in the service industry so I definitely tip based on service.

Wow, what a comedy show! Mr. WAL-MART PANTS at the front door was so busy 0n his cellphone he didn't have time for us. Empty restaurant with waiters standing around, no one else waiting to be seated. We stand there ignored for 10 minutes, and leave. From what I saw of the menu, it was limited and cliche. Sad, could have potential with better service.

I was invited to a birthday brunch here on a Thursday. The person who invited me to this event informed me that brunch is normally available only on Sundays. So this review is limited to a closed party. The staff on hand was friendly and very attentive. With the special menu we were offered three dishes. 1) Maryland Crab Eggs Benedict 2) Buttermilk Fried Chicken & Waffle 3) Short Ribs & Fried Egg Sandwich. I picked the  Maryland Crab Eggs Benedict it was very good in fact the best Eggs Benedict I have ever eaten
Andrew is so hot. The things I would do to him  he gave me his number but I'm scared to call

Came here for brunch after church, the food is excellent! I'd have to say a bit over priced for small items but i'm more impressed with the service.. our waitress, Tanya did a fantastic job. She took very good care of us and provided a great dining experience. So welcoming and friendly, she made sure our waters were filled and was very timely on checking in with us if we needed anything. Will definitely be back again soon!

Love Tivoli and had not been here yet so stopped in for Happy Hour which runs 3-6pm daily.  Nice casual ambiance sitting at the bar. The globe lights above the bar were awesome. We ordered the overstuffed bacon and eggs (deviled eggs), buffalo onion rings, and Hamptons Burger.  Buffalo onion rings get 5 stars from my hubby and I.  Eggs were solid.  Burger just ok... but the spiral fries served with the burger were pretty darn good.  Look forward to trying a few other items on the menu next time.

I'm not saying don't come here, because you could (and hopefully do) have a much better experience than I did. 

We, a family of 5, came here for Mother's day lunch - well after the rush had already left, and the tables had been cleaned. The server was sweet but gave us the impression she was busy elsewhere the whole time. Two of us ordered bottomless mimosas, which they came back to refill twice. Not a huge deal, but.. it's supposed to be bottomless. Just keep coming back, yeah? 

We ordered Beignets as we sat down. We then had to ask each and every time they came back to the table about the Beignets. Again, no big deal, but just bring the Beignets. 

One of us ordered the BLTE that never made its way to the table. We eventually had to cancel the order as everyone was already almost done with their meal. 

Now.. the food. The swordfish sandwich was inedible simply because of its size. The fish itself was very tasty make no mistake. The steak fries it came with were great, too. Just hard to eat the dish how it was served. 

The chicken sandwich was awesome. Opposite of the swordfish sandwich, the bite was perfect. Crispy chicken cutlet with a sweet slaw and pickles, with a side of buttery hot sauce.

The chicken sandwich was the saving grace here but the rest of the food and the service were not enjoyable. 3 stars for the waitress kindly waiving the mimosas from the tab. This proved it wasn't just us that felt this way about our experience here.

I'm looking forward to coming back and having a better time.

Came here on a whim, but very impressed!
Ordered the short ribs witch cheesy potatoes and sweet carrots. Very tasty. Friend ordered the grilled chicken burger which was also good. 

They have happy hour and daily deals. Service was great - our bartender was super friendly! Dont remember her name but she was tall. They have a great menu and drink selection and brunch too. Recommend the kombucha moscow mule.  Will definitely be back.

Updating previous 4 star review - they changed their happy hour and menu so that the drink specials only include well drinks and one kind of wine - mondavi. No thanks. The manager found out and offered us a deal on wine which was excellent service and unexpected.  He mentions that this was an adjustment period and next week there would be a better hh menu with other options. This was much appreciated and will bring us back! We even ordered desert (a yummy carrot cake which was recommended by the waiter) which we hardly do. Thank you for the good service.
Service was slow and inattentive. Coffee was lukewarm and watery. Food was really mediocre--and not cheap. Very poor all the way around.

One and most favorites place for branch and dinner !
Great food and carrot cake to dye for
Really good food. Like-really good! Service was great too. We sat at the bar and Andrew was super on top of things!

Food was great, service was very good and friendly. The one thing that turned me off was the ambiance and the music. I almost fell asleep at the table listening to the slow music. A restaurant like this should have upbeat more fun music, not slow paced, boring music. I want to have fun when I go out and not be out to sleep. Food was good enough to go back but make it early to not fall asleep.

Had brunch here for a friend's birthday. It's located in Tivoli Village close to where Echo and Rig is. I usually park underground and take the elevator upstairs to where all the restaurants and stores are. 

The inside of the restaurant was decorated nicely and it has a nice, open feel to it. Patio seating is available as well for those that are interested. 

I did make a reservation through OpenTable and the hostess found my name in their system with no problem. 

All of us got the bottomless mimosas. They have the choice of orange juice or cherry. I tried both because why not? I wanted to get my money's worth haha. Both were tasty so can't go wrong really. 

Complimentary beignets: great way to start a meal! I wasn't expecting this so it was a nice surprise. Each guest gets 1 beignet and it's topped off with powdered sugar. It was light and wasn't overly sweet. 

Mushroom brie bruschetta: I love brie and I love mushrooms so I decided to give this a try. It was just alright. The flavors went well together but I was expecting the bread to be a bit more toasted for that nice crunch. 

Egg white frittata: simple dish with veggies (asparagus, spinach, and cherry tomatoes) topped off with cheese. Comes with a side of potatoes. This is a great choice if you want something light and simple. I figured since I'm drinking my calories in mimosas, that I should stick with a light meal. 

Our server was great! Kinda bummed I can't remember her name. She was attentive and checked on us regularly without being too invasive. She always made sure our mimosas were full and that we had everything we needed. 

Come check them out when you have a chance!

Go for Sam! (Hot tall bartender with a little sass) And if you're there you might as well have some good food and nice wine. Crab cakes are moist and flavorful. Salmon crepe is amazing! I have always  thought of a crepe as a dessert but this is so delicious. Smoked salmon with heirloom tomatoes and cucumber sauce sandwiched in a crepe. Yum!  The gentleman next to us had a braised short rib on risotto that I was drooling over. Love the ambience with the open outdoor feel. Perfect weather. Will be back for more of the menu and for Sam's crafted cocktails!! I hear she makes a mean vodka al vodka :)

Came in for lunch with the family. We ordered the double stuffed deviled eggs, avocado fries, hummus, wedge salad, tomato soup, Hamptons burger and Mac n cheese! The presentation was great and every dish was delish!!! Our server was very attentive. The restaurant is very stylish and has a great vibe! Got to meet chef Jay personally too! Definitely coming back again when here in Vegas!

I like to weekend in The Hamptons. 

I've only been for brunch but I've been 3 weekends in a row. 

The service rivals any great restaurant on the strip but the prices are Summerlin.

We reserved for a party of 8 and it turned into a party of 12 and the staff was incredible.

Absolutely delicious cocktails great wine list and the food is fantastic.  Country Chicken buttermilk sandwich is so tasty.  We sat outside.  Great ambiance.  I love this place and will definitely be back.
Bartender wonderful, Owner right  there and didn't introduce himself( not good) place not even busy!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. Absolutely fantastic service and food. Braised short rib dinner, french onion soup, tuna tartar, tempura avocado and last but definitely not least the bananas foster dessert. Great atmosphere and great place to spend a relaxing with friends. Don't miss this place !!!! Huge compliments to the Chef !

This is a lovely place. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I never had to ask for a refill or wait long for service and the food. The menu has some variety and nice options. I just didn't see anything that really amazed me. 

I found the food to be tasty and some options seems to be a little small but pricey but overall go here with friends or family or a date and it'll be a nice time with great service.
Food was fresh and cocktails were delicious. Very impressed with the service as well! Definitely will be back.

Brunch. The 15.00 all you can drink Mimosas got my 23 year old to come along happily. We ordered one Traditional breakfast and the Green Chili pork stew. The bliss started with complimentary lemon beignets, a delicious and a great start to our experience. The traditional breakfast came with delicious breakfast potatoes, and that says a lot because I don't even like potatoes really. Crispy bacon and large slices of Sourdough toast. The stew was more like soup, but with huge pieces of pork, lots of cheese and an egg on top. The presentation was terrific. This is definitely somewhere we can't wait to visit again.

After much talks with a friend, I've decided to finally make it out to try Hamptons. 

Appetizer: Avocado Fries
-Great presentation.
-The lime crema I believe it was, I preferred over the house ketchup.

Entree:  Chicken Sandwich
-Great presentation, and great balance of flavors. I was hoping to get more of the apple flavor in the slaw that was topped on the chicken. 

Dessert: Peach Cobbler. 
-Great flavor and presentation as well. Came out nice and hot. It had a little too much salt for my taste from the salted caramel I believe. Overall, I enjoyed it.

I will return to enjoy the rest of the menu.

I recently had a birthday brunch with 15 gals and the food was delicious and the customer service was wonderful. From the moment I called make the reservation the host was very polite and helpful. When having such a big group is always a hit and miss but the server was on top of it, there was a few discrepancies on the billing but they removed the items. We did the bottomless mimosas and they kept them filled at all times. The food was delicious. I would really recommend this for a large party. The decir is very chick and clean with great indoor and outdoor space.
Very nice Happy Hour menu.  Loved the avocado slices tempura style with green goddess dressing. The dinner menu looks amazing. We'll be back for dinner!
Bottomless mimosas on the weekends 12-3pm! The service is great! Our waitress was amazing; ask for Tania when you come in! We're definitely going to come back.
Excellent meal. Excellent service. Ask to sit in Lisa's section. She provided excellent service. Hampton's is now on our favorites list.

Can't say enough GOOD things about this amazing eatery. Celebrating my Mom's 89th birthday with family was spectacular. Fresh beautiful foods prepared in eye catching colors with delightful aromas. The Hampton chef is NOT AFRAID OF FLAVOR and this is what makes the eating experience exhilarating. It's a party in your mouth and you have to be ready for a flavor ("O").

Five of us sat on the patio for dinner. I ordered the cuban sandwich with no "5 spice pineapple". I asked if I could have something else in place of the fries, perhaps a side salad or veggie. He said "sorry, no substitutions". I jokingly said "I'll literally take anything else you want to put on the side, just not french fries." Again, he said "No substitutions" and then pointed to the menu where it stated that. There were probably less tables in the restaurant than I can count on my one hand, this is not something that should've been refused in my opinion. My sandwich came out with the pineapple on it and no pickles, another fail. I asked for a side of pickles, no problem. The sandwich was probably a 5 out of 10.

Three of my friends said that their food was "very average", and my one friend who ordered the ahi tuna salad said it was one of the worst he'd ever had. We wanted to order dessert but figured that would be disappointing too, so we passed.

Cherry topper: the check comes out with auto-gratuity of 18% on there (that's supposed to be for 6 or more people). We tell our server and he says "Oh sorry, it automatically put that on there by mistake. I'll get it taken care of". BS!!! I've worked in the industry for many years, and with every POS system, the server had to manually add on the 18-20% gratuity for large parties.

Super disappointed with this place. Will not be returning and wouldn't recommend eating here if you haven't tried it yet.

We came here for the first time Friday night and called ahead to ask how late they serve their full menu/seat for dinner as I was getting of work late. The website and yelp say 10pm, but the girl on the phone - after initially telling us 10pm - said they were open until 11pm. We asked how late they seat and she said 11pm. 

We arrived around 10:30pm and were immediately brought water and the waitress took our drink order - but she didn't seem to know the menu. 

My husband ordered a Sculpin - one of the most popular beers in the US right now - and she said 'a what?' so he pointed it out on the menu. He added an oder of whiskey and same thing 'what? What is that?' he pointed it out on the menu. The beer list is pretty blah so I opted for the Kombucha cocktails and when I asked how strong the bitters were as both the Guava and Strawberry version list bitters in the ingredients - same thing AGAIN! "What?" The bitters, do they use a lot of bitters. "Bitters?" yes... finally she told me that she had tried both and the bitters were not overwhelming... 

The Guava Kamubcha cocktail was interesting in a good way and I did enjoy it. The bitters were not overwhelming. 

But then things went very down hill. After bringing out drinks our waitress walked by our table no less than 6 times before taking our order - so it was closer to 11pm before we even put in our food order. It was ok as we were enjoying our drinks, but given what happened later, it seems pretty absurd. 

The table next to us had been seated after us and received their food ahead of us and the place was not busy at all, like 3 tables and maybe a few people in the bar. I would have guessed our waitress went on break, except that she walked by our table so often. 

The Hamptons burger w/ fries was very good - thick burger, cooked nicely and flavorful. Same for the fries. Wedge salad was well constructed and had the right amount of tomatoes & bacon to go with the lettuce. The side of ham mac and cheese was just ok, trying to be a better version of what your mother made growing up, but not quite there. Avocado fries were meh as well. If you're looking to replace the amazing avocado fries found at the no-longer Nine at the Palms, you'll be disappointed. The artisan ketchup was a nice twist. 

The reason we WILL NOT be returning though happened at the end - we finished our meal and the waitress brought the check, we paid and my husband was still finishing his whiskey when a different waiter came to our table and said - being very snotty - that we would have to leave. 

"We need you to leave, we've been closed for about an hour now." We were both so taken aback by the rude and pretentious attitude that we really didn't know what to say... it would have been comical had we watched the night play out from a distance. 

We were told Hamptons served until 11pm- we showed up at 10:30 and waited a good 30 minutes for our order to even be taken. So a restaurant that claims to seat and serve until 11pm, then also expects to be shut down and close for the night... AT 11PM? 

I'll also add that when we arrived and said 'two for dinner' the hostess made no mention of things shutting down soon or that we would need to hurry and order as the kitchen was almost closing, ect. This after we had been told on the phone they served until 11pm. 

It appears the staff and management need to figure out their actual hours and operations. Do they serve until 11pm? Or is it lights out at 11pm? Or is it 10pm, like their website says? If it is, why did three people on the staff say 11pm. And why do you have another waiter kicking customers out when they've only just finished their meal you served to them at 11pm? 

There are at least 100 other restaurants around that have the same quality and style of food at the same price point as Hamptons. We won't be returning. We can both honestly say nothing like that has ever happened to either of us.

I took my family there for a casual dinner and ordered several dishes that I was told were the "best" on the menu by the server. All the dishes were 'okay', but one was so bad I actually had to send it back. 

The short rib burger was good but not really worth the price. 
The avocado fries looked nothing like the pics seen here. They were barely breaded (more like sprinkled with panko) And delivered to our table. Nothing special. 
The French onion soup was good (best thing I ordered). 
The market veggies with rice was terrible. I actually asked if I could send this dish back because it was that bad.   The veggies didn't go well with the black rice nor did the flavor. Not sure what they used to cook it but it was extremely bland and gross. 
The corn bread was average. 
The chicken tenders weren't anything special (they tasted like they had been reheated). 
The trout had roughly 2 cups of cooked butter beans on top (couldn't even see the fish). 

Overall the best thing we all ate were the fries.

If I could give the shit hole no stars, I would. The food was good. I will admit to that. The service sucked. Our waitress or server, Lisa was a bitch. She was very rude and very condescending. We were never asked once how our meal was. This place is not recommended.

It's a heady atmosphere here. You almost feel as though you could be in that tony, celebrity-filled eponymous enclave in New York where "A-listers" wine and dine and pretend to hide from the paparazzi. The problem is that you may be a little underwhelmed by the lack of attention that YOU get, commoner. It feels very much like you are not a "somebody" here. And that if you were a "VIP" the experience would be a lot different.  There is very little attention to the customer experience. It is as if the Hamptons folks believe you should feel yourself at home in the understated but very "on" hipster decor, and forward-trend food, and not need anything else. But you do. We patrons STILL need to feel as though we are welcomed, and that the restaurant is happy that you stopped in. 

Instead, Hamptons is like that girl who always gets asked to the dance, and your tremulous invitation to her is met with a, "Meh, I guess." In other words, where your patronage is concerned, you are met with a firm "I can take it or leave it" feeling where Hamptons is concerned. That might work in New York. But that is not a good state of mind for Las Vegas, particularly at Tivoli where even more imaginative and satisfying restaurants like "Poppy" (by Angelo Sosa of "Top Chef" fame), and "Tapas" (by Alex Estratta), crashed and burned in the EXACT same spot.  

We shall see.  I may give them another chance when I can maybe bring a "VIP" so that I get what I suspect is the "A-list" treatment at the restaurant and update my review.  

If you do go, sure, the avocado fries are interesting and different, and worth a try, but not as amazing as other reviewers make out. They were a tad greasy the night I went. The trout, however, was perfectly cooked and presented.  The glass of sangria I had was surprisingly delicious.

This restaurant is a new joint built on, what I'd like to call, "culinary Pet Sematary." Sure, it seems nice to have a restaurant in this Tivoli Village spot "come back" but then it's just not the same and borderline scary. Then it's dead again.

In short, the food was okay, but nothing spectacular. The decor is Northeast WASP privilege like the name suggests, but the patio space is what made this multiphase location so great.

We had the deviled eggs, avocado fries, and more delivered by a server who seemed mildly irritated by us, but seeminlgy tolerated us enough to maintain a minimal tip. "W," when customers smile at you and look you in the eye, it's a good thing. Try not to get ahead of yourself. 

Another server who was assisting in cleanup also cleared out plates with an eyeroll. She droled on and on with the table next to us about her Nonna's cooking and when she came to our table, it was with a scowl. I didn't understand the pretension considering we visit Tivoli Village quite often, but it's not a great start for this place - one with a history of restaurant failures. 

We won't be back. A solid 3: for meh-mediocre food and service. The minimalist Hamptons look was okay, but this is Summerlin after all.

Never coming back!! 
We first came in here for dinner with my husband, I have to tell you it was a great presentation. It looked nice inside. However when we ordered, our steaks...
The pork chops looked big good but when my husband tried to eat it it was very tough. When he mentioned it to the waitress the waitress replied," do you have a doggie?" 
My husband relied ,"no" she continued saying ,you better get one." 
Didn't even bother to fix it for us. Didn't even grab a managers attention so that tge manager could fix it for us. In addition to that they were not even busy at all.  
We ended up paying $143.97 for a meal that wasn't good

Came here w/ a friend for a December Sunday brunch. Weather was nice so we sat outside. (I remember coming to eat here in the past when it was a tapas place.)
I ordered a cherry mimosa which came out as an OJ mimosa. 
We ordered the mushroom and Brie bruschetta which came out as the apple ricotta bruschetta. 
My lemon blueberry pancakes were tasty.  
Took a while to get the check- we asked it to be split. My check came back fine. There was a bit of a mix up with my friend's. Took even longer for the waitress to come back with our CC.So long my friend had to go get the waitress. 
Food and ambiance and price was ok, but I feel there are other restaurants in town with similar menus. That can offer up better service.

Had dinner with my wife on Valentine's Day. The meal was outstanding. The double pork chop was fantastic... very tender, tasty, and outright huge!! My wife had their salmon and she loved it. Drinks were excellent  as were our appetizers and salads. Staff was very friendly. We ate outside which was quiet and comfortable, but we paid a price as our server was never around. Overall the experience was very good. Prices were in line within the area. Would recommend Hamptons for your next meal in Summerlin.
Great service and accommodating staff. Owner, Howard is delightful and listens to his customers. Chef Jay comes with delightful interpretations of standard dishes and creative approach to his own.
I just went for a happy hour glass of wine, but the place was beautiful and the staff was friendly. I'll definitely go back and have dinner there sometime.

Hamptons was a great experience. I had the burger and I would absolutely recommend it. We also shared the buffalo onion rings. Lisa was our server was really nice. She was on top of the service and had good recommendations. Next time I'll take advantage of their $20 wine bottle Wednesdays. Check this place out!
Nice building, nice staff. Went for happy hour and it was overpriced. Everywhere else in tivoli village has much more reasonable prices for HH.

Awesome brunch. Bottomless is truly bottomless cherry or orange but strong and keeps coming from 10-3. Food is great as well. Blueberry pancakes are fluctuated and fresh and large. Not much lemon taste wise, but still well worth a go. French onion soup warm and hearty and Hampton burger as good as it gets. Burger specifically come full with pickles, lettuce, tomato, fired egg, and pickles which is nice as many burger in town come super plain. Food is great and bottomless is unbelievable service-wise. Great outdoor area with tvs and spray for the hot summer weekends. Hampton's shows up as one of the best brunches in town and easily top 2 or 3 on the west side. Well done.

We recently had one of our UNLV Hospitality mixers here, and it was a great experience! The staff was very accommodating, and they have plenty of space! It is a two-story restaurant with a nice quiet tucked away bar upstairs! There is seating outside on the upstairs level as well.

Menu is a little pricey I might add; $13 for a Glenlivet on the rocks; but understandably so. I still have yet to try out the menu. Will definitely be returning soon!

Great venue for drinks or food. When it's warmer out they open the bar outside which I love. My friend and I Came for happy hour, we enjoyed a delicious vodka with this wonderful cucumber soda they have. We ordered the salmon crepes which were tasty. They were light but a good size portion. The avocado fries were lightly fried and yummy. The third thing we got was the deviled eggs. They were great! Wish it came with more than 3.

We frequently go to tivoli village.  We were pleasantly surprised to find a great happy hour menu. The braised green chili pork and corn bread was sublime  the wine and beer was great. Andrew our bartender was very attentive and gave excellent service. Would definitely recommend this business.

It's a cute little place, our waiter was really nice and attentive. We ordered the deviled eggs which were so big! But also big in flavor with the crispy bacon. I also ordered the Hampton burger which was really good with there crazy fries.
I enjoyed the food, the atmosphere and the great service.  I loved the avocado tempura and the sea bass....yummy, tender and very tasty !! I will certainly go back to try their other items.

Definitely a nice brunch spot to check out located inside the beautiful Tivoli Village. Came here on a whim but we enjoyed. Greeted and seated right away - staff stayed friendly and attentive throughout our entire experience here. Beautiful patio seating & bar, very trendy ambiance. Bottomless mimosas are always appealing! Unique menu/dishes that we were excited to try.  Loved the apple ricotta bruschetta but unfortunately I wasn't a fan of the lemon blueberry pancakes - very soggy. I can't recall what my boyfriend ordered but I know that he enjoyed.

Found this place while wandering around Tivoli Village a couple weeks ago. It was around 7 pm on a Friday and the place was pretty dead. My first impression upon walking in was how oddly quiet the place was; it made things kind of awkward especially after sitting down and feeling like the people at the booth next to us could hear our conversations (they need to turn up the music). We ordered onion rings as a starter, the Hampton burger and the country chicken as entrees. The onion rings never came out- I'm guessing the server forgot to put them in. The burger and the country chicken were mediocre at best and the fries that came with both tasted ridiculously salty. Sub par service/ food and not much of a variety on the dinner menu- probably wouldn't return.

Went here for brunch on Sunday. The place hits on all cylinders. We sat outside and they turned on the heater for us. When the sun came over us they asked if we wanted it off and did so. The service was awesome. Usually when we order the bottomless mimosa's you have to flag somebody down for the refills. Not so at Hamptons. The bottomless mimosa's really were bottomless since we never saw the bottom of the glass. The atmosphere is great sitting outside with a view of the village. 

I had the trout and eggs everything cooked to perfection. She had the crab Benedict which was just as good. The overstuffed eggs appetizers were great. I've the fancy deviled eggs at many places but these were the best I had. 

Atmosphere, Food and Service. Hamptons hits on all three.

Sad Sunday at hamptons at travoli we really look forward to visiting hamptons it was extremely slow service, bartender was in over her head with 7 guests never once did she say I'll be with you she never came to our side of the bar after getting up to leave waiting 15 minutes its like we were invisible with the owner at the front door I thought he liked us, can't order the carrot cake without the service 
Might try again. To be continued with the next visit maybe

Hands down my new favorite brunch spot in Summerlin... affordable, delicious, great atmosphere, and amazing service! We never had to ask for anything, the staff just knew when we needed something. We sat outside (where dogs are allowed)... our puppy was getting restless so our waitress brought over a piece of bacon for him! Definitely coming back!
I would recommend this place for a nice dinning experience and a fantastic brunch.  Don't miss out!

Stopped here for weekend brunch and opted for bottomless mimosas and avocado toast. The bottomless mimosas are meant to look like a good deal (around $20 where as a single mimosa is $11) however since they're mimosas are already overpriced (around $6 at most brunch spots) I dont know if I'd recommend the bottomless. However, the food, waitstaff, and atmosphere are all great. Great spot to stop at after visiting the farmers market.

Had a great meal! So lucky that Kacey was our server - she made great recommendations! The bartender Andrew was cool - recommended the gratin potatoes and they are just as phenomenal as he said. Best filet I've ever had! Absolute must!

Went there last night for dinner and nice place! The portions are small for the price. I paid 22.00 for one chicken breast which I felt was expensive considering it's a single breast. Staff is nice however was not to happy with the prices and food was just okay.

All I have to say is BRUNCH!!! It was even better than I expected. Definitely do yourself a favor and get the bottomless mimosas as well. George was an amazing waiter, never let my glass go past half full. I'll definitely be a regular.

Very impressed with The Hampton @ Tivoli Village..chris and I went for Sunday brunch to try somewhere new and wasn't sure what to expect because the last 3 restaurants haven't done well. Very impressed with the whole vibe, my breakfast pictured here was delish and chris had the blueberry pancakes, also delish..definitely going back in the evening soon to try dinner and cocktails..Jeremy our server was terrific!!!

Updated Review. First experience was far from the best.  I had two other people who are in the hospitality industry and the three of us couldn't believe all the challenges. I wrote a review and the management reached out and not only invited us back but corrected all the challenges. This past Sunday night we again visited. The menu has been corrected to reflect the dishes available. The Pork Stew appetizer was big enough for a meal (it was a bit salty but note that neither of us salt our foods). It was very tasty. The NY Strip was cooked to perfection. The mashed potatoes are not a side of potatoes but more of a smear on the bottom of the plate. My guest said they were great and would have like just a bit more of them. The presentation was nice. The Trout with the white beans was fresh and nice option for fish. The avocado fries are well an acquired taste. For someone who loves avocado this just isn't my thing. We also had the deconstructed Buttermilk Chicken sandwich (no-bun). It was tasty but not what was expected. When you think of Buttermilk Chicken you think of the thick and crunchy batter. Don't get me wrong it was great but it was more like a lightly battered chicken breast. Would order again.  The staff is on point and very attentive. This is becoming a nice addition to Tivoli Village.
We had an 18 person table and actually got fantastic food and service. Highly recommended this place.

Start with the awesome avocado fries and move on the the perfectly prepared burger. Ground in house with a blend of chuck and short rib. Served with an amazing thick curly fry. 
We will definitely be back.

So we're at the Hamptons now and we're having wine therapy Wednesday with Andrew. Yeah amazing Andrew is above and beyond anything I've ever experienced! So as Andrew's recommendation we are having crabcakes, the hummus with the salted lemons that are marinade for 30 days upstairs before they're made into this pot of joy fabulous presentation and then we had of course the world famous avocado fries! We're watching the Vegas Golden Knights game we're still here in real time come join us we're ready to find something more spectacular on the menu because Andrew is actually taking us on a journey that is amazing

My first visit is a brunch review with the fiery bbff on a lovely Saturday day.  I'm a fan for their brunchy brunch...

Service: I really wish I would have gotten our server's name as she was wonderful! We dined outside in the patio and she was always checking on us and kept our bottomless mimosas truly bottomless.  She was very friendly and got our orders out to us quickly.  After closing the bill, she kept bringing the mimosas as we hung for another 15 minutes catching up. Fantastic..

Brunch Food:  They brought out 2 complimentary beignets to get us started and they were great.  The honey and powdered sugar was just enough.  The overstuffed bacon and eggs which ended up being fancy deviled eggs was so tasty.  Definitely a brunch staple moving forward. The short rib and fried egg sandwich was such a great messy sandwich to eat.  The short rib and the eggs compliment each other well to make for a great breakfast sandwich on a french roll.

Ambiance: Inside, they had a higher end Contemporary Pottery Barn minimalist decor feel going on which made for a visually pleasing dining experience.  The bar was attractive and looked well stocked with the premium stuff.  Chairs, tables, silverware are all definitely meeting the Summerlin standards for a restaurant in Tivoli village.

I have a new brunch place where I want to try new dishes.  The prices offered value for the quality and location which was a nice surprise. The $15 bottomless mimosas fuels some great conversations over a great brunch meal. Smaller dogs with other patrons were in the patio dining area on our visit which I totally enjoyed as I'm a dog person.  Weekend brunches at the Hamptons is a thing for me in the future when I'm on this side of town.  Enjoy yourself, it's a celebration..=)

Great food, great atmosphere with an awesome patio and open air bar.  the service is exceptional from the management down to the food runner everyone went above an beyond both times we were in there for brunch.

The service was great at this restaurant, but the food was disappointing. In Las Vegas brunch spots are incredible so your food has to be very good to compete! I had the crab cake benedict and it arrived cooks and although the mini crab cakes were good the benedict and all its ingredients were very bland. The breakfast potatoes were nice and crispy but nothing special. The cherry mimosas on the other hand were fabulous, not sweet, but nice and tart. However the food not being good and the fact that the patio is tucked in the side alley of the restaurant, adjacent to another restaurant's patio, so there's no view or outlook into Tivoli square to people watch, means I won't be going back. Echo & Rig all the way if you're brunching in Tivoli.

Really enjoyed the food. The yelp promotion for he deviled egg apparently is only if you buy the deviled egg appetizer, they will give you another egg. Swordfish sandwich was well prepared, and the fries were tasty. Dogs are allowed on their patio, and the restaurant provided a water bowl, which was appreciated.

I heard about this place from one of my clients. He was raving about it and as I was researching places to take my sister for her birthday I decided to take her to Hamptons. I knew exactly where it was as I am very familiar with Tivoli. 

I made reservations for my sister and I @ 11a and in the reservations comment box I had mentioned it was my sisters birthday. As we walked in, it was completely empty. They had just opened. We were greeted by a nice hostess and seated outside at a reserved table. 

The hostess asked whose birthday it was and she said happy birthday to my sister which was nice. As we were seated we were going over the menu, but already knew we wanted mimosas to start. Some time has passed and I remember looking around like where the hell is our server. It's not busy and it doesn't take long for us to decide on drinks. Finally, our server came and got our drinks. 

We ordered the hummus and avocado fries to start. Both delicious and light. Then, my sister ordered a salad and I had the chicken & biscuits. My sister really enjoyed her salad and I loved my dish. Not very appealing looking in the bowl but the flavors and the juicy chicken and biscuits were delicious. 

All in all, Service was good after the first initial 5-8min of just sitting there. It's a bit pricey so keep that in mind. 

I gave them 4 stars because I specifically mentioned in my reservation that it was my sisters birthday. Only the hostess mentioned anything. Would've been nice if the server said something as well or even surprised her with a little dessert. 

Would I eat here again? Sure. But I wouldn't take someone here for a special occasion as they didn't really make it one.
We had lunch and ordered the deviled eggs and avocado fries. Excellent!  We enjoyed our lunch, great service and very helpful with menu. Great ambiance and location at Tivoli. I will be back!

Another amazing addition to my favorite village in Las Vegas. I'm amazed anyone would want to follow up a restaurant at the death corner, but I'm glad Hamptons took a stab at it. This place sure delivers on the ambiance as well as the brunch quality. You cannot miss on the breakfast favorite. I personally prefer to splurge on their burger which looks and tastes like a steak in a bun. I love the fact that you can actually tell they ground their own meat! For the love of god, DO NOT order past medium for the burger! That's sacrilege to overlook this work of art! Their curly fries are bomb and the most unique I've ever come across. Fluffy lemony pancakes? Heck yes! Amazing banana waffle? Just stuff it in my mouth, I don't need to chew! I hope you survive this death corner Hamptons!

my third time eating at this restaurant. The decor is beautiful, the food is varied and quite good. The french fries are terrific-as was the bananas Foster .
Our server, Lisa, was so sweet ,friendly and very helpful. We will be back.

We've been wanting to try this place for a while now, finally went to try it. Got seated quickly and great service from start to finish. Ordered the famous Avocado fries and if you like food with flavor and something new this is defiantly the appetizer to try! Lime burst and perfect Avocado texture. We also ordered a Country Chicken sandwich and Hampton burger and they were both equally amazing in flavor and perfectly cooked! My burger was medium well and they couldn't have done a better job at it! The Country Chicken was crispy and rich with flavors! The fries that come with them were bbq season and hot when they got to us! One thing I always like is hot meals when they arrive to the table! I couldn't do dessert for once too full! Must try place. Ryan the manager was doing what all managers should do in restaurants being kind,  attentive, and social. Great place!

With so many options in the area Hamptons needs to up their lack luster lunch service game to draw a meaningful following. Had the ahi tacos with the shattering to bits one bite shells making the order a folk only experience.

Another brunch spot in Tivoli, why yes please! Some friends and I came here on a Sunday for some bottomless mimosas and brunch. We were able to make a reservation which was great and the ambiance inside is super cute and trendy. 

I loved that the mimosas came between a choice of orange or cherry and they made sure to keep our glasses full. The food was also excellent. I had the crab cake benedict which came with potatoes. The crab flavor wasn't too overbearing and I loved the hollandaise on top. They also provide you with complementary beignets which were excellent. 

The only thing they need to work on is the service. Our waitress initially delivered the whole table the wrong flavor of mimosas and also delivered our entrees wrong. I think over time they will get better, but either way I'd still come back again.

While the food was great, the bill for a party of 9 was so messed up we basically gave up. For a place trying to be high end, too bad they can't keep track of other tables' drink orders that ended up on our bill. Double check your math$$!

It's not that easy to find a great brunch with ambience food and service! I'm glad we chose the Hampton's bottomless mimosas great location and reservations were easy even though it was breezy out we made reservations for outside brunch they accommodate us just fine! Bff and I were happy

Great spot with very good food. I tried the deviled eggs which were hearty and delicious. The Swordfish Sandwich and fries were also very solid and the Green Chile Stew with Cornbread was out of this World. Very nice people that run the place as Chef Jay came out to check on people as you can tell they really care. I give them an A for the food and A for the customer service. Will definitely be going back.

What a wonderful restaurant! They have a great indoor/outdoor/upstairs with industrial and sort of old school decorating. The service was great. I brought a group for lunch and everyone had different dishes to try them. The swordfish sandwich looked fantastic. The salmon dish looked fantastic. My crab cakes were not the best I have ever had. The Hampton burger was different with the eggs on top. My husband said the taste was a little bland. The Cubano sandwich look good. The salads looked good also. We were given the room at the top for privacy since we were a group. Unfortunately some of my group did not show but the restaurant took that in stride. I know some of us want to go again to try the happy hour and the steaks. There was one steak, I think it was 40 oz. for $120 on the menu. A little much. The management was wonderful giving us separate checks as requested. We will certainly go again. Easy to get to with valet parking and underground parking.

Ordered the wings and fries to go on a Sunday morning.  The spicy sauce was good on the six small wings but they completely forgot to include the smoked ketchup they advertise for the fries.  They came in a large box and filled it about a quarter of the way, if that.  For $23, I got six wings and a rather small portion of ketchup-less fries to go with no napkins, no utensils, and no condiments.  But most memorable was paying for it at the bar. Maybe he was having a bad day, but the bearded bartender brought the order over, stuck a bill in front of me, and made no eye contact and no greeting.  Not even a thank you for my business after I paid. Maybe I'm being too picky, expecting a certain level of decorum and friendliness?  This is a new business, not one with employees who have been there too long and don't like their job any more. First time I failed to leave a tip, even on a to-go order.  Honestly, I've never felt less welcome when patronizing a restaurant. To be fair, the young girl/hostess was sweet but she wasn't really involved with the order.  I'd have to think long and hard before ever returning to Hamptons, even when relatives come to visit.

enjoyed a good lunch, only 2 tables taken  and nobody at the bar between 1 -3 pm so I hope business improves. We enjoyed all of the food: buffalo onion rings freshly made with a wonderful sauce, crepes with smoked lox salmon, green apple and blue cheese salad, salmon mignon, swordfish sandwich. Service was very slow. We will return. The decor is very nice.

Tivoli Village where Hamptons is located is always a favorite with a variety of good dining options. Been to Hamptons twice now and was impressed on both occasions. First time had the lemon ricotta pancakes. This is a trendy dish so wasn't expecting more than a "me too" experience. Quite the opposite. Expertly executed. Even those dining with me who are "meh" on pancakes thought well of them. This past SA the green chili pork stew caught my attention. What a delicious meal. The braised pork was suspended in a savory and perfectly crafted soup(?) with a fried egg floater. As promised it comes with a plgrilled green chili on the side. Simply delicious. Oh, and a nice piece of corn bread to boot. Overall a perfectly composed dish that I highly recommend. Look forward to my next visit. Funny thing though about the location. Since opening this location in Tivoli has probably gone through about a half dozen restaurants. We always joke that the location is jinxed. Hope Hamptons can break that curse. PS, almost forgot, both time we were treated to a comp dish of beignets. Beignets are one of those items I'm always weary of. They almost always come across looking and tasting greasy. These are just wonderful. Take that Cafe du Monde...

I took my out of state guest there for dinner yesterday.  We were seated in the patio at our request since it was such beautiful weather.  I am a local and had read the review of the restaurant in a Sunday paper and was excited to try it.  We ordered a Scratch Margarita which was very strong and sour.  Not the greatest.  We ordered the Preserved Lemon Hummus to start.  Hummus was delicious, but there was too much hummus and not enough bread or crudites.  We sat with dirty plates and silverware forever.  I had to get up and go inside and ask for our server (all the wait staff was standing around gabbing).  Someone other than our server came out and removed the dirty dishes and brought us clean plates and silverware.  Our server came out and said "someone was supposed to have done that."  We got our food and it was delicious.  We ordered the Green Chili Pork Stew and Buffalo Onion Rings.  Stew was delicious, as were the onion rings.  Our server never returned to ask if everything was ok or if we needed anything.  We sat with empty water glasses until after our plates were cleared.  Our waiter was completely disinterested in our table.  Not sure I want to return.

I normally don't rate this low. They lost a star for mis-advertising the yelp check-in offer (get free deviled egg with order). It sounds like the entire appetizer order. No, you have to order the appetizer then they give you one extra. Okay, fine. Then when I got the hotcakes they didn't taste as they were described. They are: Lemon & Ricotta Souffl Hotcakes with vanilla whipped cream and honey butter. I didn't taste, lemon, vanilla or honey. The deviled eggs are delicious but I was not impressed w the hotcakes. In terms of my beverage and dining at the bar, Josh went above and beyond w my old fashioned. He customized it based on flavors I enjoy. If I could rate him separately, I'd give him five stars. This place is right next door to Echo & Rig, so if I gotta choose between the two based on food alone, I'd choose E&R next time.

Must try for appetizers: Apple ricotta bruschetta The hummus platter, crab cakes and French onion soup. I've also had the onion rings, deviled eggs and buffalo cauliflower. They are good but no my favorites. Entree wise: the short rib or sword fish are my favorite. I've had the New York strip which is good but I still think Echo & Rig is my go to spot for steak.  There is something for everyone. The restaurant is pretty intimate so it's nice for a small birthday party or family dinner.

I came with 2 girlfriends for lunch on Sunday. We left another lunch place due to a long wait so we were pleasantly surprised that when we called ahead here we didn't need a reservation and were seated right away. Hampton's is two levels with pretty amazing decor. We definitely came under dressed but now we know for next time. The food was bomb- we ordered Caesar salad, tomato soup (pictured), potatoes (pictured), egg Frittata and fruit. My friends only complaint was the price for fruit when it was only a cut up apple and 3 berries. All in all amazing menu- really excited about coming back and trying more! The only reason I can only give it 4 stars was because of the service. We had to ask twice for silverware to start. Then I ordered crispy potatoes to come out early and it came with the rest of the food. We probably waited 30 minutes from when we finished eating to when we saw our waiter again to get our check. There was only 2 tables besides us so it seemed like our server must have had tables upstairs and downstairs and was the only one assigned upstairs. We would love to come again, better dressed and to order some fun drinks.

Don't know if we will go back. Was not happy with several different dishes my table ordered for dinner.
Friends say the wine nights are great so may give it another shot. Felt the pricing was too expensive for what we got
Amazing. One of our favorite Sunday afternoon lunch spots. Small space so you could wait a bit but the food is definitely worth it. Nice atmosphere and staff is friendly.

Stumbled upon Hamptons one evening while perusing the shops and restaurants in Tivoli.  
Entered and immediately noticed the indoor / outdoor bar seating!
Greeted by the bartender- attentive and enthusiastic!  With that, we decided to be seated at said bar;)  the bartender immediately and cheerfully provides us with a run down of his clearly vast knowledge.  Is he a bit of a legend in the circles of bartending?!  We order and said bartender makes sure our cocktails are chilled to perfection and we are satisfied!  Now, bring on the appetizers and entrees please.  We had a number of appetizers, not a few (a handful).  Then the entrees and those desserts cannot be passed up!All were palatable, served perfectly and with a personality.  Now, let me give said bartender a name- Andrew. 
I've returned a number of times just for his enthusiasm, service and care of making palatable and delicious drinks!
Thank You!

Brought our daughters and their Homecoming Ball dates here. Nice ambiance, interesting menu, and great food (except the cold French Onion soup, which was quickly rectified). Waitstaff were attentive and friendly. Drinks came quickly from the bar. 

Everyone enjoyed their experience. 

It's way on the other end of town from us, but we would definitely stop in again.

Great dinner and great service by Christina!   Hemingway cocktail was perfect.  . Buffalo Onion Rings were yummy. Great concept. Filet cooked perfectly and risotto was amazing!  Ohhh and the desserts!  Yum.   We will be back!

This restaurant has been open since September 2017 in Tivoli Village. It was hard to choose what to eat because the whole menu sounds good. The bruschetta made for a great appetizer. Sourdough topped with Brie and mushrooms with a balsamic reduction drizzled on the plate was mouth watering. The main course of grilled lemon chicken pita was very good. Hummus as a condiment was a nice touch.

We just had dinner at Hamptons for the first time and we may have found our new favorite dinner spot.  We felt appreciated from the moment we walked in.  The crab cakes were delish, the braised rib and side dishes were perfect and our server Lisa was just lovely!  I will be back and recommend Hamptons to our friends!  Oh, and the specialty cocktails were perfect!

Came here for my birthday brunch on a Saturday morning around 11.  I had read multiple reviews on yelp and decided to give it a try... I was not disappointed. 

I made a reservation for 6 of us and we were seated almost immediately outside on their patio. To start we had the Avocado Fries and the Overstuffed Bacon & Eggs. They were both delicious. And the fries even came with a homemade ketchup. 

As the entree I had the BLT & E (egg). It was a huge portion and came with a side of potatoes and garlic aioli.  We also all did bottomless mimosas which I loved the fact there were two flavors to try (orange and cherry). 

I'll def be back for brunch again and would love to try their happy hour. (I only docked a star because service became kind of slow as the restaurant became busier.)

Wow! What a wonderful addition to Summerlin and Tivoli Village. We were with neighbors last night and had an outstanding dinner. We were seated at a beautiful outdoor patio and Rick our server was a true professional. He made some excellent suggestions. He had avocado fries and crab cakes for appetizers. The avocado fries and crab cakes were not greasy but simply delicious. For dinner we had the trout entree, swordfish and short ribs. The short ribs were tender and the fish entrees were also. What made all of these entrees exceptional was the preparation and presentation. Then we shared dessert, peach cobbler and bananas foster.  All desserts were  amazing. We had a relaxing meal in a beautiful setting without blaring music that many restaurants foist upon their patrons. We will return and bring friends.

Was looking forward to a good experience as a friend had recommended this place. Unfortunately, it didn't work for us. There were lots of little things wrong: watery onion soup; caramelized carrots were hard and tasteless; we asked if they served bread (because there were bread plates on the table) and we were told NO (after the server went to the kitchen to see if she could get us some bread. She said "he" said no); they gave us the wrong check and it took about 10 minutes to get the correct one to us. Another table got a good deal on that because our check was lower. :-) Prices are somewhat pricey but not too bad. All in all, we won't be going back. There are too many GOOD restaurants around to waste time going back here.

From the moment I picked up the phone and called for a reservation, the service was impeccable. When I arrived at the restaurant I had made a reservation for two and I needed to change it three and no problem they immediately seated us. Our waitress Tania was super nice and overly accommodating. I wanted bacon and waffles instead of chicken and they replaced it with no problem. We had more than enough mimosas. Great place.. I forgot when we first got seated outside it wasn't an umbrella available so they moved us upstairs and it was really nice.  Thank you to everyone that made my experience wonderful.. I will be back

The Hampton Burger is excellent. Good enough quality beef to be ordered medium rare. The catch-up is a little funky because they put their own spin on it. If you're lucky, they'll deliver it to the Cigar Lounge for you.

I really wanted to love this spot; unfortunately, my experience was far from enjoyable. Because I have dietary restrictions (vegan with celiac and thus requiring gluten free), I called ahead and was informed there would be no issue--the kitchen could easily accommodate by preparing anything requested from the ingredients on the menu.

Accordingly, my date and I decided to try Hamptons on a Friday night and were able to easily book a reservation last minute through OpenTable. We initially opted to sit outside on the patio but were turned off by the large groups of children running around bumping into chairs, which was odd considering the sign stating no one under 21 could be in the area due to the presence of the bar. 

After being seated inside at a booth, we ordered drinks and began to peruse the menu. I ordered a kombucha-based Moscow mule that was disappointing and I certainly would not recommend. The cocktail was somehow watered down, yet overly sweet at the same time. At this point, I just hoped my dinner would be better than the dismal cocktail; I mean, how do you annihilate a Moscow mule?

Unlike what I was told when I called to inquire about dinner options, I was told the only thing that could be made was the vegetables with forbidden rice entree (which honestly sounded good). I made sure to ask the server, who was quite jumpy and borderline nervous, to triple check with the chef to ensure there would be no gluten in my dish. I really didn't want to ruin Memorial Day weekend feeling like garbage. I felt uneasy about the server's "assurance" that the dish was safe for celiacs as she and others didn't seem to understand what gluten is and if it might be present in the dish I ordered. Nevertheless, after my third inquiry about gluten, and namely, the presence of soy sauce, I figured the dish was safe and I could eat without worry of falling ill. That was a mistake.

When the dish arrived I was pleasantly surprised as it looked better than expected; however, I was concerned that soy sauce seemed to be in the coconut sauce (based on both appearance and scent). I really didn't want to make a fuss as my date already seemed to think I was being neurotic (those without celiac truly don't understand the suffering we endure with gluten). I decided to go ahead and eat the entree, and about 2 minutes later, I began to have severe stomach pain. When I asked for the fourth time if the dish had soy sauce, it took THREE people to get a solid answer and two of them NEVER returned. The manager that finally returned to break the news even tried to deflect by saying simply, "there's soy in the dish". FYI: soy is NOT gluten. Soy sauce, however, has gluten due to the presence of wheat. Soy is NOT soy sauce! The staff here seriously needs to learn their ingredients and be WAY more cautious about serving individuals with allergies/celiac disease. I was CRYSTAL CLEAR that soy sauce was unacceptable and that soy alone would not induce any symptoms of celiac disease. Again, soy and soy sauce are two different things!

Overall, Hamptons was extremely careless and handled the situation poorly. I do understand it's unpleasant to tell a patron they have just been given an ingredient that will make them sick (i.e., poisoned), but I do not understand the outright inability to face that patron and tell them the truth. In the case of a food allergy, it could potentially be a life or death situation. Based on my experience at Hamptons, I will not be returning, and I will certainly not recommend this establishment to anyone.

My wife and I had an amazing time at this really amazing restaurant. Everything was perfect, all the way to the weather outside so we enjoyed the sun along with perfectly prepared food and amazing happy hour drinks. Hands down we will be regulars now!

This place is beautiful! The decor is perfect the staff is pleasant but most of all the food is AMAZING! The avocado fries are to die for and the BBQ Bacon burger is the best burger I have ever eaten.  I love clear across town but would make the trip over hear as often as possible.  Yum!
Avocado Fries are amazing! Lemon hummus deliciously served with crudits   We filled up on starters but the other patrons raved about their meals! Definite yes you must come here  !!!
Amazing brunch. They were out of a lot of specials when we went, but service was great. Good for groups too.

Sever did his job well but did not friendly.  Food was below average for the price.  Buffalo onion rings were good but avocado fries had no flavor.  My husband had the Prime Rib Pork Chop which was over cooked. My kids had the Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich which was delicious, but the braised short ribs and grilled swordfish were both very dry.  I had the Hampton burger which was bland and tasteless.  The menu looked amazing which made it so disappointing .
This is probably one of the best spots in Summerlin. The food is incredible, affordable, and inventive. Bottomless mimosas, great service and dog friendly. What else do you need?

One of our favorite restaurants in Tivoli Village. We happened to stop by after Symphony Under the Stars and was pleasantly surprised with the entire experience. 

Deviled Eggs - 5/5 This is delicious all around, and I enjoyed how OVERSTUFFED they were. Of course, this was not your typical deviled eggs as they had a hint of heat to it along with yummy textures from the sliced bacon bits and celery. It's a must try. 

Chicken Pita - 4/5 I love everything about this sandwich. It's not too heavy but it's not too light either. It has the right balance of vegetables and hummus that just made it refreshing to eat even for dinner. This, however, did not come with fries. It came with pickled vegetables which was a sweet surprise. I didn't actually think that I would like it because it really resembled boiled vegetables but, it was yummy! This is also a must try. We were told that this was the vegetable that it come with the appetizer hummus that you order separately. So I thought this was a 2-in-1 combination. 

Cubano Sandwich - 5/5 Not your average sandwich as it had the right balance of condiments, meats, and vegetables. Think about this food as, revolutionary. I also loved the seasoned fries it came with. It's a must get! 

Country Steak Chicken - 4/5 Delicious but I prefer the Cubano! Hey, they can't always be perfect, right? 

Chocolate Cake - The best chocolate I've ever had and this is coming from someone who doesn't really like chocolate cake. It's rich with the right balance of frosting. It's also very big, and can easily be shared with four people! 

Carrot Cake - Yum! My favorite cake made even better. It's moist, rich, and all-around-delicious. This is also very similar to the chocolate cake which is huge in portion! Easily shareable with four people! 

Service: Honestly, it's not the best. It's about your average service which can be a hit or miss. A lot of times they'll tend to ignore you or they'll take a while to serve. Not a fan and I hope they change it! 

Ambiance: Love the design and the intimate setting here. There's an upstairs and a downstairs area and also an outdoor. We always sit inside downstairs possibly because we don't have a reservation. But nonetheless, it's modern with a tough of industrial. Kudos to their designer because I love coming here partly because of the ambiance.
